item.title: Optional parameters in minimal apis
item.description: Daily Knowledge Drop When using minimal apis in C#, while query string values will automatically be extracted and send to the lambda expression, they are by “default”, required values. Defaults can also not be supplied, as lambda expressions do not allow default values. Either the minimal api needs to use a method (as opposed to a lambda expression) or the parameter needs to be nullable, with the default value being set in the lambda body if not passed in.
